intro: Euryops somalensis, commonly known as the Somali aster, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Euryops somalensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar and habitat for various wildlife species.
